description.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for most disadvantaged children.

sector.narrative: Adolescents participating in or leading civic engagement initiatives (including in humanitarian settings)
Capacity building for nutrition preparedness and response

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child Protection humanitarian AoR/humanitarian sector coordination
Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Humanitarian planning and review activities (HRP, RRP, UNICEF HAC)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Situation Analysis or Update on women and children
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children

description.narrative: Other General Services support to civil society
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities disaster prevention and preparedness
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in India (Adolescent Development and Participation)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2017 India: Reducing Stunting in Children Under Five Years of Age: a comprehensive evaluation of UNICEF’s strategies and programme performance – India Country Case Study
India 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
India Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for most disadvantaged children.

description.narrative: Risk Informed Programming was integrated in the 2018-22 country programme and up-scaled to five states. Child-centred disaster risk reduction was strengthened through development of two additional state DRR Roadmaps, review of 96 statutory District Disaster Management Plans, and endorsement of six state governments to scale-up School Safety and Security programme. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2018

title.narrative: No. of states with key institutions, civil society organizations and communities having knowledge and skills on effective child centered DRR and CCA.
No. of flagship programmes incorporating child centered DRR, CCA and civil strife concerns

Key stakeholders (disaggregated by government, civil society, PRIs, community leaders, families) in selected areas who know and understand their duties and responsibilities towards ensuring adolescents

No. of hazard/ climate change vulnerable and affected states in rural and urban settings with a plan to address gaps and remove bottlenecks for improved access to services and protection for the most deprived adolescents.

baseline.value: TBD based on gap survey conducted in 2013
